intro: Swertia iberica, commonly known as the Iberian swertia, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Swertia iberica is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in alpine and subalpine ecosystems.
